title: Arpeggio: Minor b6th in C (Shape: E)
content:
# Arpeggio: Minor b6th in C (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio consists of the notes C, Eb, G, and Ab. It is known as a minor b6th arpeggio in the key of C and falls under the shape E.

## Notes and Intervals
- C is the root note
- Eb is the minor third (b3)
- G is the perfect fifth (5)
- Ab is the flattened sixth (b6)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, blues, and rock music styles to add a sense of tension and color to the music. The minor b6th interval gives a distinct dark and mysterious sound to compositions, creating a unique harmonic flavor.

## Songs
1. "Purple Haze" by Jimi Hendrix
2. "So What" by Miles Davis
3. "Sweet Home Chicago" by Robert Johnson
